plugins.name: Clean Gradients
plugins.description:
Problem:

When using a standard gradient with two colors, if there is a large gap between their tones, the saturation in the middle decreases significantly, and the color in this area may appear grayish-resulting in a ¬´muddy¬ª shade.


Solution:

With just two clicks, the plugin eliminates the ¬´muddy¬ª effect in the middle of the gradient by adding three additional intermediate color stops.


How to use the plugin:

1. The colors for the initial gradient can be taken either from an existing gradient element by selecting it and clicking the ¬´Pick gradient¬ª button or by using the ¬´Color Picker¬ª tool on the left and right of the button.

2. To apply the gradient, select the desired element and click the ¬´Apply gradient¬ª button.
plugins.tagline: Cleans the gradient from ¬´dirt¬ª

plugins.name: Autolayout converter Helper
plugins.description:
Effortlessly locate frames and take control of your design exploration!!!


Navigate to complex Figma layers with ease! This plugin helps you traverse design hierarchies by stopping at frames and allowing you to decide the next move. Customize your search‚Äîpause anywhere and pick it up whenever you're ready (at that moment perform your change at layer‚ú® ). Perfect for designers and developers who need precise, targeted frame navigation.


Key Features :

  1. Start Search from Any Node : Begin traversal from any selected layer in your Figma file, drilling down through layers and frames.
  2. Stop on Frame Detection : Pauses at each frame, allowing you to review, edit, or proceed to the next frame.
  3. Customisable Navigation : Choose from Next to continue, Skip to bypass children, or Custom Stop to pause as needed.


Use Cases :

  1. Designers and Developers : Streamline work on large, complex Figma files with multiple frames and layers.
  2. Efficient Frame Location : Locate frames quickly, without tedious manual scrolling.
  3. Auto Layout Validation : Essential for platforms or projects requiring strict auto layout adherence for accurate design and responsive outputs. This plugin helps ensure each frame aligns to the full auto layout setup, ensuring optimal structure and consistency.
  4. Flexible Layer Exploration : Customize your traversal to focus on only the layers that matter most for faster design reviews and targeted edits.


How to Use :

  1. Select your starting node in Figma, click Start, and let the plugin begin searching.
  2. When a layer is detected, choose Next to proceed, Skip to bypass children, or Custom Stop to pause where desired.


Boost productivity, stay organized, and manage complex Figma designs with this efficient layers finding plugin. Ideal for design reviews, auto layout validation, focused edits, and streamlined development workflows!
plugins.tagline: Navigate layers with ease: control traversal and reduce your manual drilling time by 40%

plugins.name: Mots AI
plugins.description:
Elevate your UI designs with this intelligent Figma plugin that generates smart, context-aware text tailored to your needs. Powered by advanced AI technology, it streamlines your content creation process, allowing you to quickly produce engaging copy for various UI components.


Seamless Integration:


This plugin seamlessly integrates with your existing Figma workflow. Simply highlight the text area in your design that requires content, specify the context, and select the appropriate UI component. It will generate customized, realistic text that perfectly complements your design, saving you valuable time and effort.


Intuitive User Experience:


Designed with user-friendliness in mind, this plugin boasts an intuitive interface that allows designers to focus on their creative process. It currently supports English language generation, with plans to expand language support in future updates. The plugin adapts to your needs, making it an indispensable tool for designers seeking to streamline their workflow and boost productivity.


How to use this plugin:


Select text area:


Highlight the text layer or frame in your Figma design where you need content generated.


Provide context:


Specify the context of your design, such as the user story and acceptance criteria, to ensure the plugin generates relevant and appropriate text.


Choose UI component:


Select the specific UI component (e.g., button, link) for which you need text.


Generate and refine:


Let the plugin work its magic. Review the generated text and, if needed, refine it to achieve the perfect fit for your design.


‚Äî



Got more ideas?


Send them our way at contact@juny.com


www.juny.ai
plugins.tagline: Revolutionize your designs with AI-powered text generation

plugins.name: logoplacer
plugins.description:
Logo Placer simplifies the process of adding multiple logos to your designs while maintaining clean spacing and visual consistency. Perfect for partner sections, client showcases, sponsor walls, and more.


Features:

Upload up to 4 logos with automatic placement

Smart resizing that maintains logo aspect ratios

Multi-frame support ‚Äì Select multiple frames and place logos simultaneously

Dynamic scaling based on frame size

Equal spacing between logos, every time

Reset button to quickly start over

Clean and intuitive interface


Ideal For:

Creating partner/client sections

Designing sponsor walls

Showcasing collaborations

Building marketing materials

Presenting design portfolios


How to Use:

  1. Select one or more frames in your design
  2. Open the Logo Placer plugin
  3. Upload up to 4 logos
  4. Watch as they're automatically resized, placed, and spaced
  5. Hit reset to start fresh anytime


Why Use Logo Placer?

When you have a lot of design assets and deadlines, placing logos manually can be tedious and error-prone. You often deal with:


  1. Inconsistent sizing
  2. Uneven spacing
  3. Manual alignment headaches

Logo Placer removes that friction by automating placement and ensuring a professional layout every time‚Äîno grids, nudging, or guesswork needed.
plugins.tagline: "Automatically arrange and space multiple logos in your designs"

plugins.name: Page Forge
plugins.description:
Create templates for page names and apply them across all your projects.


Especially useful for teams with different types of projects or organizations.


How it works:

plugins.name: Writing Assistant
plugins.description:
The AI Writing tools for designers

It helps you refine your UX copywriting, make it more concise, friendly, and scannable using AI.

  1. Super easy to use, one click to refine the copywriting
  2. 5 variants in one request
  3. Modifications are adjustable from light to heavy


How does it works?

The AI writer will analyze and refine your original content from three metrics: concise, friendly, and scannable. Just one click, you will get the refined copywriting, the changes of score of these three metrics can help you make decision from those 5 refined variants.


Scientifically define good copywriting

The model is base on Microsoft style guide, thanks to the efforts of these talented designers, we are able to know how to evaluate a copywriting and how to improve it.

plugins.name: Orange Tokens: Theme & Tokens
plugins.description:
Description

Orange Tokens helps you turn any base color into a full set of tints and shades ‚Äî instantly and intelligently. Now with Typography Token support, you can generate consistent, scalable color and type systems right inside Figma.


Whether you're building a new design system or scaling an existing one, Orange Tokens eliminates guesswork and manual setup ‚Äî so you can focus on design, not variables.


No more manual tweaks or guesswork ‚Äî Orange Tokens helps you scale your colors the smart way.


üöÄ How to use

  1. Enter your base colors and name them
  2. Choose how many display/text styles you want
  3. Click ‚ÄúGenerate Variables‚Äù
  4. Orange Tokens generates color variables and synced text styles automatically


‚ú® Features

  1. One-click color palette generation
  2. Auto-generated tints & shades from base colors
  3. Typography tokens + text styles generated together
  4. Organized variables with design token‚Äìfriendly naming
  5. Great for theming, dark/light modes, and scalable systems
  6. Fast, clean, and easy ‚Äî even at scale


‚öôÔ∏è How it works

Orange Tokens uses structured algorithms to create harmonious tints, shades, and typography styles from your input. Each color or text style is mapped to a logical name and stored as a Figma variable ‚Äî ready for use across your entire system.


Everything updates in a few clicks ‚Äî no broken styles, no messy overrides.


üí¨ Feedback and feature ideas?

This is just the beginning ‚Äî future updates will explore typography tokens, spacing, mode support, and more. Have an idea or request? Email me at inamdar.chinmay25@gmail.com, or leave a comment on the plugin page!

plugins.name: Typosys
plugins.description:
Typosys is a Figma plugin designed to simplify and accelerate the creation and management of typography systems.

By selecting a base font and size, you can effortlessly generate styles that scale proportionally. The plugin supports custom naming, font faces, weights, sizes, line heights, and letter spacing. It also introduces a multi-dimensional mode system, allowing you to tailor styles for specific devices like desktop, tablet, and mobile. Once completed, the styles are imported into Figma, fully linked to dynamically generated variable collections.



Benefits


  1. Faster workflow: Set up your typography system in minutes.
  2. Consistent scaling: Styles are proportional to the base size for a cohesive design.
  3. Flexibility: Each style can be individually customized.
  4. Device-specific optimization: Use modes to adjust styles for different screen sizes.
  5. Variable integration: Styles are automatically connected to dynamic Figma variable collections.



Key Features


  1. Base font and size selection
  2. Proportional typography style generation
  3. Customizable font face, weight, size, line-height, and letter-spacing
  4. Mode-based dimensions (Desktop, Tablet, Mobile)
  5. Automatic variable generation and linking
  6. One-click import

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer ‚Äî crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.name: Component Viewer
plugins.description:
Component Viewer Plugin for Figma


Overview: The Component Viewer plugin enhances your design workflow in Figma by providing a quick and easy way to visualize all components and instances present on a page. With a simple button, you can activate or deactivate the highlighting of components, making it easier to manage and review your designs.


Features:

  1. Instant Visualization: Quickly view all components and instances on the current Figma page.
  2. Simple Toggle: Activate or deactivate the highlighting with a single button press. The button is centrally located for easy access.
  3. Custom Highlighting: Components and instances are displayed with a vibrant red fill when activated, making them stand out clearly against the design.
  4. Reset to Default: Deactivating the plugin restores the original appearance of your components, ensuring no permanent changes are made to your design.


User Interface:

  1. Centralized Toggle Button: The intuitive interface features a toggle button with two states:
  2. Activate: Displays components in red with white text.
  3. Deactivate: Returns components to their default state with a light grey background and black text.
  4. Responsive Design: The plugin interface is designed to be clean and user-friendly, ensuring a seamless integration into your Figma environment.


Use Cases:

  1. Perfect for designers looking to audit their components and instances within a project.
  2. Useful for collaborative sessions where multiple team members need to focus on specific design elements.


Installation: Simply select Component Viewer plugin from the Figma plugins menu, and you‚Äôre ready to streamline your design process!

plugins.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin allows users to visually highlight suspected components within a design, making it easier to locate and manage components. The plugin is ideal for users who need to inspect multiple components and interact with them quickly.


Function Description

‚Ä¢Highlight suspected components in selected frames.

‚Ä¢Locate and zoom into components within your Figma file.

‚Ä¢Export thumbnails of components for visual reference.

‚Ä¢Easily toggle component highlight on and off.


How to Use

1.Select one or more frames from your Figma file.

2.Click the ‚ÄúShow Component Highlight‚Äù button to highlight suspected components.

3.View the component list with thumbnails and names.

4.Click the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to zoom in and select a specific component.

5.To remove the highlight, click ‚ÄúHide Component Highlight.‚Äù


Notes

‚Ä¢The highlighted components are based on the plugin‚Äôs interpretation and might not fully match actual component usage.

‚Ä¢The plugin‚Äôs results are for reference purposes and may vary depending on design complexity.

136415.name: DTÁªÑ‰ª∂È´ò‰∫Æ DT Component Highlighting
136415.description:
Introduction

This Figma plugin allows users to visually highlight suspected components within a design, making it easier to locate and manage components. The plugin is ideal for users who need to inspect multiple components and interact with them quickly.


Function Description

‚Ä¢Highlight suspected components in selected frames.

‚Ä¢Locate and zoom into components within your Figma file.

‚Ä¢Export thumbnails of components for visual reference.

‚Ä¢Easily toggle component highlight on and off.


How to Use

1.Select one or more frames from your Figma file.

2.Click the ‚ÄúShow Component Highlight‚Äù button to highlight suspected components.

3.View the component list with thumbnails and names.

4.Click the ‚ÄúLocate‚Äù button to zoom in and select a specific component.

5.To remove the highlight, click ‚ÄúHide Component Highlight.‚Äù


Notes

‚Ä¢The highlighted components are based on the plugin‚Äôs interpretation and might not fully match actual component usage.

‚Ä¢The plugin‚Äôs results are for reference purposes and may vary depending on design complexity.
